videos.title: If We Love Him - 2019 Mutual Theme Video
videos.description:
"If ye love me, keep my commandments." —John 14:15

"If We Love Him," from If We Love Him (2019 Mutual Album)
By Nik Day, sung by Lauryn Judd

LYRICS:
Love is more than just a word;
It’s more than just a feeling in our souls. 
Love is why He came to earth,
To be the hope we turn to
When we feel alone.

We can love like He loves us
When we walk in His footsteps.
If we love, if we love Him, we will show Him.
We’ll go and serve our neighbor with an open heart,
Find the heavy hands and try to lift them up,
Live the way He lived and do the things He taught if we love Him. 
If we love Him.
If we love Him.

He has given us direction
So that He can bless us with His grace. 
As we show Him that we love Him, 
Follow what He says,
We’ll be forever changed.

We can love like He loves us
When we walk in His footsteps.
If we love, if we love Him, we will show Him.
We’ll go and serve our neighbor with an open heart,
Find the heavy hands and try to lift them up,
Live the way He lived and do the things He taught if we love Him. 
If we love Him.
If we love Him.
If we love Him.

When we love, everything changes.
His love sustains us.
So we’ll take all the love that He gave us, That He gave us,

And go and serve our neighbor with an open heart,
Find the heavy hands and try to lift them up,
Live the way he lived and do the things He taught if we love Him.

We’ll go and serve our neighbor with an open heart,
Find the heavy hands and try to lift them up,
Live the way He lived and do the things He taught if we love Him. If we love Him.
If we love Him.
If we love Him.

videos.title: Far Away
videos.description:
Do you have childhood memories of Christmas? Did you hear the story of Christ’s birth in a far-off land? Have you asked yourself, like the Wise Men, “What can I bring?” This season, share the story of the Savior’s birth with younger generations. As you do, the meaning of Christmas will shine through every tradition of the season. Old and young will feel closer to Him. Listen to this message from performing artists The National Parks.

videos.title: Wheelz: Overcoming is Possible
videos.description:
Aaron “Wheelz” Fotheringham is a member of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints—commonly referred to as a Mormon or Latter-day Saint. He’s also an elite wheelchair motocross (WXMC) athlete and has performed some of the riskiest world record–setting wheelchair stunts. He was born with Spina Bifida and was in a wheelchair by the time he was 8 years old. That’s when he started to develop his wheelchair skills at a local skate park and he’s never looked back. 

At 18, Aaron “Wheelz” found himself touring the world with elite action sports athletes. Those long tours took him away from his weekly Church meetings. In time, with all his trick progressions, he noticed some spiritual regression. After struggling with wondering if he’d ever feel happiness in the gospel again, Aaron turned to the Savior, Jesus Christ. Once he realized that Christ was always there to save him and that he just needed to turn to Him, Christ’s redeeming joy filled his life again.

Aaron “Wheelz” believes anyone can overcome challenges when one has faith, hope and the Atonement of Jesus Christ.

if we just let Him in.

🎧 Lyrics:

Chorus:
When your hope is fading
And the stars refuse to shine,

And your burdens drag you down,

And His hand is reaching out.

He will stay by your side,
And He’ll warm you with His light,
So, give your will to Him.
That’s when the miracles begin.

And the stars refuse to shine,
Though you’re stumbling in the dark,

And His hand is reaching out.

But He won’t take your hand until you reach for it,
So, reach for Him.

And the stars refuse to shine,
Though you’re stumbling in the dark,

And His hand is reaching out.

Pillar of Light | Official Track Video | feat. Grant Lemon | Youth Christian Music

Written by Nik Day
Arranged by Nik Day
Produced by Scott Wiley
Artist: Grant Lemon

🎧 Lyrics:

Darkness covered the earth.
People were looking for truth,
But it was taken away so long ago.
God was preparing their hearts
So He could light up the dark,
’Cause it was time for a new beginning.
There was a boy who needed answers,
One that was chosen by God,
So, he went and found a place to pray.

Chorus:
And when he prayed,
A pillar of light rested on him.
The windows of heaven were opened again.
They called him by name.
Chosen by God,
he was part of a bigger plan.
It all began with a pillar of light.

Shining bright as the sun,
Heavenly rays of love
Started drowning out the darkness.
And everything that was lost
Was given back to us
In a spiritual restoration.
God showed us we were not forgotten,
And He provided a way.
All because a boy knelt to pray.

Chorus:
And when he prayed,
A pillar of light rested on him.
The windows of heaven were opened again.
They called him by name.
Chosen by God,
he was part of a bigger plan.
It all began with a pillar of light.

God the Father and the Son appeared
To place a little piece of heaven here.
They showed their perfect love for us
With a pillar of light.
A pillar of light.

Chorus:
A pillar of light rested on him.
The windows of heaven were opened again.
They called him by name.
Chosen by God,
he was part of a bigger plan.
It all began with a pillar of light.
A pillar of light.

I Will Go and Do | Official Track Video | feat. David Archuleta | Youth Christian Music

Written by Nik Day
Arranged by Nik Day
Produced by Scott Wiley
Artist: David Archuleta

🎧 Lyrics:

No matter where I go,
I know I’m not alone.
I feel my Savior there beside me.
He leads me through the night.
— He’s always been my guide.
He promised He will never leave me.
Though my burdens seem too much to bear, He’ll bless me.
So, whatever He commands,

Chorus:
I will go and do.
I will stand for truth.
Though the world may back away,
I will walk right through.
I know if I follow Him, follow Him in faith,
He will ease my burdens and He’ll provide a way.
He’ll provide a way.

When I feel overcome
and all my strength is gone,
I think of all the ways He’s blessed me.
My journey may seem long,
but He’ll lift me with His love—
A perfect love that’s never-ending.
He will give me, give me all the strength I’m needing.
So, whatever He commands,

Chorus:
I will go and do.
I will stand for truth.
Though the world may back away,
I will walk right through.
I know if I follow Him, follow Him in faith,
He will ease my burdens and He’ll provide a way.
He’ll provide a way

for me to cross the desert,
to sail across the ocean.
If that’s where He sends me,
I’ll follow His plan.
I’ll do whatever He commands me,
for I know that He will lead me to the promised land.

Chorus:
I will go and do.
I will stand for truth.
Though the world may shut Him out,
I will make Him room.
I know if I follow Him, follow Him in faith,
He will ease my burdens and He’ll provide a way.
He’ll provide a way.
He’ll provide a way.
No matter where I go, I know I’m not alone.
I feel my Savior there beside me.

I know that I can.
I know that I can.
Mmm Mmm
What does He think about me?

videos.title: My Part in the Restoration
videos.description:
Joseph Smith isn’t much different from you. He actively tried to understand the Lord’s will for him. He searched the scriptures. He pondered. He prayed. You can hear the Lord’s voice as you seek Him.
 
President Russell M. Nelson invited you to prepare for the for the April 2020 general conference by reading the account of Joseph Smith’s First Vision, as found in the Pearl of Great Price. As you read it, think of your part in the restoration of the gospel of Jesus Christ. How do you hear the Lord speak to you? #HearHim

videos.title: Good Day
videos.description:
Things have been hard but you're going to have a good day because God is with you!

Written by Nik Day
Performed by Liahona Olayan

Lyrics:
I think I know better
I think I know how it should be 
I got it all planned out
But He’s got a plan for me
When it’s bad weather 
Sometimes I yell up at the sky 
Today was supposed to be dry 
But that’s not what I need

Pre-chorus:
Life’s so unpredictable 
And things might not be going my way 

Chorus: 
But It’s gonna be a good day
Though things are going sideways
I got a smile on my face 
And nothing’s gonna bring me down 
Cause I know
Whatever happens He knows
He’ll never leave me alone 
I’ll be ok
And it’s gonna be a good day

He made all the planets 
He made all the stars in the sky 
He knows what he’s doing 
And he’s gonna make it all right
So when the wind’s blowing 
There might a be reason it is
Something I’m learning 
Something that I’ll never forget 

Pre-chorus

Chorus

videos.description:
Watch how this 12-year-old young man, Prophet, started setting goals and learned to play the piano. Prophet is a member of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints. Prophet made another goal to teach basic piano playing skills to his friends and people in the community. He offered free lessons, and soon there were over 50 people taking lessons!

Prophet enlisted some young men in his youth group, and they taught three times a week at their local church. What started out as a simple plan to learn the piano ended up blessing an entire community. What good things may come from your goals? #StriveToBe

videos.title: Cooking Competition | Goal Setting
videos.description:
This Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints youth group had a goal setting idea to plan and lead a cooking competition. The young men and young women were immediately involved from creating a menu to buying food at the market and from inviting friends to cooking together. They gathered as teams—young men vs. young women—and made banku and okra soup. 

Banku and okra soup is a crowd-pleasing African dish. Banku is a mixture of fermented corn and cassava dough and is often served with soup. Okra soup is made with fish, smoked turkey, okra, and other vegetables and seasonings. 

When children and youth learn to lead, they gain confidence, build friendships, and become empowered. #StriveToBe

videos.title: A Great Work | Face to Face
videos.description:
This segment is from the Face to Face Broadcast with the General Young Women's Presidency.

A Great Work (2021 Youth Theme Song)

There is a work to do
That’s been prepared for you
Long before the world was made
You have the strength you need
To cross the stormy seas
That you will find along the way

Pre-chorus:
He is your refuge from the storm
And you will never be alone

Chorus:
This is a great work
That we’ve been given
This is a part of
His grand design
So, don’t be weary
He will be with you 
And He will lead you
through the night
In this great work
This great work
This is a great work

If you give Him your heart
He’ll show you who you are
And all His hopes and dreams for you
And when you follow Him
The great work will begin
And perfect love will win

Chorus

Bridge:
This is His work and glory
And He wants you by His side
So He can help you find your place

Chorus:
In this great work…

This is a great work
A great work
This is a great work

I am a son of God.
I am a son of God.

Never know you’ll
Never know

The water

But it’s almost like you lost your way 
Took a few wrong turns

Falling behind now 
Looking for grace 
Cause you need someone to lift you up
Make right all the things you done 
Cause on your own you’ll
Never know you’ll
Never know

If you believe
You can move the highest mountains
Cross the greatest oceans
And walk across the water
The water

If you believe

His Kindness in Me | Official Track Video | feat. Emily Bea | Youth Christian Music

Written by Nik Day
Arranged by Mitch Davis
Produced by Mitch Davis
Artist: Emily Bea

🎧 Lyrics:

He was the kindest man on earth,
Never turned anyone away.
Beggars and lepers would come to Him,
And He would take away their pain.
He cared about the children
And held them on his knee.
And He prayed for them
Just like He prays for me.

Chorus:
Oh, I wish that I was patient,
I wish that I was kind.
I wish that I was like Him,
And I put away my pride.
I make mistakes, I close my heart,
I push away, I fall apart.
But I won’t stop till
I see His Kindness In Me.

He gave comfort to those in need,
And He lifted weary hands.
He taught us how to love relentlessly,
Not just with the words He said.
He asked God to forgive them
When He died on Calvary.
And He prayed for them
Just like He prays for me.

Chorus:
Oh, I wish that I was patient,
I wish that I was kind.
I wish that I was like Him,
And I put away my pride.
I make mistakes, I close my heart,
I push away, I fall apart.
But I won’t stop till I see
His Kindness In Me.
His Kindness In Me.

Chorus:
Oh, I wish that I was patient,
I wish that I was kind.
I wish that I was like Him,
And I put away my pride.
I make mistakes, I close my heart,

But I won’t stop till I see

We Know His Name | Offical Track Video | feat. Kainoa Sorensen | Youth Christian Music

Written by Nik Day
Arranged by Mike McClellan
Produced by Mitch Davis
Artist: Kainoa Sorensen

🎧 Lyrics:

He’s the living water.
He’s the Holy one,
The mighty King of Israel,
The Son of God.
Far and wide,
His mercy flies and fills us with peace.
He’s the Savior,
the one who set us free.

Chrous:
And we know His name.
We are His people,
we hear His voice, it’s like an echo.
We took His name upon us,
and He will never leave us.
He knows our pain,
And we know His name.
And we know His name.

We can use His power,
Do His holy work.
If we kneel and pray
In His sacred name,
We can shake the earth.
High and low, the world will know.
Everywhere the rain falls He’s the Savior,
The one who saved us all.

Chorus:
And we know His name.
We are His people,
We hear His voice, it’s like an echo.
We took His name upon us,
And He will never leave us.
He knows our pain,
And we know His name.
And we know His name.

And everything we do and say,
we do it in His perfect name,
and try to be like Him.

Chorus:
We know His name.
We are His people,
we hear His voice, it’s like an echo.
We took His name upon us,
and He will never leave us.
He knows our pain,
and we know His name.

videos.title: He Reigns | Music Video
videos.description:
Yaphet Bustos performs 'He Reigns' as part of the 2021 Youth Music Festival.

“He Reigns”

He was there from the very beginning 
He taught all the stars how to shine 
He’s the ruler of all that is living
Greatness and mercy combined 

The planets above us obey Him 
The hills and the wind sing His praise
When the earth finally comes to its ending
All the world will say 

Chorus:
He reigns
He reigns 
Feel the power in His name
He’s the master of the seas
The creator of everything 
He reigns
He reigns
He has saved us from our sins 
By His grace he set us free
We will bow before our king 
He reigns 

When He speaks He is loud as the thunder
Then He whispers as soft as the wind 
His glory fills us with wonder
His mercy frees us from sin

We will worship him forever
He’s the anchor of our faith 
When He comes in his glory from heaven
All the world will say

We know His name

Everywhere the rain falls

The one who saved us all

And everything we do and say 
We do it in His perfect name 
And try to be like Him

“He is risen, He is risen.
Tell it out with joyful voice.
He has burst His three-days’ prison

Come with high and holy hymning,
Chant our Lord’s triumphant lay.
Not one darksome cloud is dimming
Yonder glorious morning ray,
Braking o’er the purple east,

videos.description:
President Russell M. Nelson and youth from around the world perform 'Hope of Israel' during a youth music festival event held on March 17, 2021.

Hope of Israel, Zion’s army,
 Children of the promised day,
 See, the Chieftain signals onward,
 And the battle’s in array!

See the foe in countless numbers,
 Marshaled in the ranks of sin.
 Hope of Israel, on to battle;
 Now the victory we must win!
 
Hope of Israel, rise in might,
 With the sword of truth and right;
 Sound the war-cry, “Watch and pray!”
 Vanquish every foe today.

 Strike for Zion, down with error;
 Flash the sword above the foe!
 Every stroke disarms a foeman;
 Every step we conquering go.

Hope of Israel, rise in might,
 With the sword of truth and right;
 Sound the war-cry, “Watch and pray!”
 Vanquish every foe today.

Soon the battle will be over;
 Every foe of truth be down.
 Onward, onward, youth of Zion;
 Thy reward the victor’s crown. 

Hope of Israel, rise in might,
 With the sword of truth and right;
 Sound the war-cry, “Watch and pray!”
 Vanquish every foe today.
 
Vanquish every foe today.

videos.title: Your Voice | Youth Music Festival 2021
videos.description:
Yahosh Bonner performs 'Your Voice' during a youth music festival event held on March 17, 2021.

“It was just a typical Saturday morning; I didn’t know that it would change my life forever. So the rock came down on top of me, and it crushed my foot. I looked at my leg and I like immediately started screaming. And when I was sitting there I was just hoping not to die.”

 Mists of darkness all around me. 
Been so long since I have seen the sun.
 Filthy waters try to drown me. 
I’ll never make it on my own.

“Immediately we started to pray. I was praying just to stay alive and for help.”

 So my knees hit the floor, only half of a whole 
‘cause I need something bigger than me.
 And the tears that I cry rising up to the sky 
bring the hope and relief that I need.

When I hear Your voice, it’s like You come and part the waters,
lead me through the darkness.
When I hear Your voice, everything is so much clearer, 
made it through the winter.
And I know, that Your love will lead me home.
When I hear Your voice, when I hear Your voice.

“There was some hard night, nights I wouldn’t sleep at all, I would just lay there groaning or crying. I remember my amputation surgery, opening my eyes, sitting up, and looking down at my foot. I said to my dad, ‘that’s smaller than I thought.’”

 Flowing down like revelation, 
bringing peace into my soul.
 The words You whisper in the darkness, 
show a love I’ve never known.
 
So my knees hit the floor only half of a whole 
 ‘Cause I need something bigger than me
 And the tears that I cry rising up to the sky
 Bring the hope and relief that I need.
 
When I hear Your voice, it’s like You come and part the waters,
 Lead me through the darkness.
 When I hear Your voice, everything is so much clearer,
 Made it through the winter.
 And I know, that Your love will lead me home. 
 When I hear Your voice, when I hear Your voice.

“When the amputation happened, I was surrounded by this dark mist, but even at our darkest moments, when we feel alone, we can always turn towards God. And if we stay close to Him, He will help us and He will be there to guide us and strengthen us. It always gets better.”

 I hear You, You save me, I follow, You change me, You make me like I need to be.
 You tell me Your secrets, You love me, I feel it, I know I will always believe.
 I hear You, You save me, I follow, You change me, You make me like I need to be.
 You tell me Your secrets, You love me, I feel it, I know I will always believe.
 
When I hear Your voice, it’s like You come and part the waters
 Lead me through the darkness.
 When I hear Your voice, everything is so much clearer,
 Made it through the winter.
 And I know, that Your love will lead me home. 
When I hear Your voice, when I hear Your voice.
When I hear Your voice, when I hear Your voice, when I hear Your voice.

videos.title: Hold On To Me | #strivetobe 2021 | LISTEN NOW | #Christian Youth Music
videos.description:
Hold On To Me | #strivetobe 2021 | LISTEN NOW | | #Christian Youth Music | 

A friend who says "Hold On To Me" when you're having trouble is the best kind of FRIEND to have. #Strivetobe presents this 2021 track of #Christian Youth Music to remind each of us to remember to hold on to friends who lift us up when we want to quit. #Jesus is a friend like this. 

COMMENT below with a time Jesus or another friend lifted you up in a tough time.

Hold Onto Me
Artist: Patch Crowe
Songwriter: Nik Day
Arranger(s): Mitch Davis
Producer: Mitch Davis

Hold On to Me

I see your pain.
Your hands are shaking. 
You don’t know which way to go. 
Tears on your face,
My heart is breaking 
‘Cause you feel like you’re alone. 

Pre-chorus:
You think you’re losing your grip 
And you just wanna quit,
But that’s no way to live.
I will be there for you, 
Right here pulling you through 
Always. 

Chorus:
When the darkest night is crashing all around you,
When you’re fighting but it’s getting hard to breathe,
When it seems like there is nothing to hold on to,
I’ll never leave.
Hold on to me.
Hold on to me.

If you feel lost
I will find you, 
And I will carry you back home.
If you’ve given up
I’ll remind you 
of the love you’ve always known.

Pre-Chorus
Chorus

videos.title: Hear Him
videos.description:
Hear Him
Artist: Darla Day
Songwriter: Nik Day
Arranger(s): Mitch Davis
Producer: Mitch Davis

Hear Him

There is a light inside us 
Put there by perfect love.
Our Savior sees our suffering, 
And He wants to speak to us 

Pre-chorus:
And if you listen, you can 
Hear Him whisper to you. 
He will open up your eyes 
To things you’ve never seen,
And fill your soul with peace.

Chorus:
How do you hear Him?
Do you go somewhere alone where it’s quiet? 
Do you listen for His voice in the silence? 
Or feel a burning deep in your heart? 
Where do you start?
How do you hear Him?
Do you climb up to the top of the mountain?
Do you read His words and try to find something,
Something that He wants you to do?
He’s speaking to you.
How do you hear Him? 

Show Him where your heart is. 
Tell Him what you need. 
And He will lift your burdens
And tell you everything.

Pre-chorus:
And if you listen you can 
Hear him whisper to you. 
He will always be your guide.
He will bring you home.
You are not alone.

Chorus

Lyrics

Some things never fade away 
No matter how much time has past.

But I know the tide will come and wash it all away.
I could give this world the strength I have,
But when all is said and done all of that will fade.

A much higher view.
And my heart is willing
To follow You.

Send me.

A much higher view.

To follow You.

Tell me what You need;
You have my heart You have my hands.
I think I’m ready,
So, let me try.

I know I’m not perfect,
But here am I.
Tell me what You need;
You have my heart You have my hands.

So, let me try.
Here am I,
Send me.
Send me. Mm
Send me.

Faith in the Lord is a choice and a commitment. As Kenedi Anderson sings in this track from the 2022 Youth Album, we can choose to serve the Lord--no matter how hard the road may be. Faith that isn't tested isn't really faith at all. We all go through struggles and times of questioning, but we can CHOOSE to SERVE the Lord in spite of these struggles. Trust in the Lord
Thoughtfully
1. The world is crumbling at our feet.
The skies are filled with gray.
The Savior’s calling to His sheep,

We know His voice;
We’ve heard it before.

He is the light.
We’ll follow Him to the end.

Though fires may burn
And storms may rage,
When darkness comes,
We’ll find our way back home.
We will trust in the Lord.
Though tears may fall
And friends may leave,
We see His light,
And that’s where we will go.
We will trust in the Lord.
We will trust in the Lord.

The path we’re on is clear.
There may be mountains on the way,
But we choose faith, not fear.
He opens our eyes,
Fills us with peace,
Lifts up our weary souls.
He is the light, and we’ll never be,
We’ll never be alone.
[Chorus]
Though fires may burn
And storms may rage,
When darkness comes,
We’ll find our way back home.
We will trust in the Lord.
Though tears may fall
And friends may leave,

And that’s where we will go.

We will trust in the Lord.

Though fires may burn

We’ll find our way back home.
We will trust in the Lord.
Though tears may fall
And friends may leave,

We will trust in the Lord.

We will trust in the Lord.

videos.title: Trust in the Lord: 2022 Youth Theme — Official Music Video
videos.description:
“Trust in the Lord with all thine heart and lean not unto thine own understanding. In all thy ways acknowledge Him and He shall direct thy paths.” —Proverbs 3:5-6

Written by Nik Day, sung by Lizzy Newbold
Choreography by Michelle H Nielsen in collaboration with Salt Contemporary Dance 
Produced by Lucas McGraw 

SUBSCRIBE to the Youth Channel of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints for the latest videos: https://bit.ly/2Ws96cP

Visit us on our WEBSITE: https://www.churchofjesuschrist.org/youth/childrenandyouth/youth?lang=eng

___

Trust in the Lord

1. The world is crumbling at our feet.
The skies are filled with gray.
The Savior’s calling to His sheep,
And He will lead the way.
We know His voice;
We’ve heard it before.
We know the words He says.
He is the light.
We’ll follow Him to the end.

[Chorus]
Though fires may burn
And storms may rage,
When darkness comes,
We’ll find our way back home.
We will trust in the Lord.
Though tears may fall
And friends may leave,
We see His light,
And that’s where we will go.
We will trust in the Lord.
We will trust in the Lord.

2. We won’t be blinded by the rain;
The path we’re on is clear.
There may be mountains on the way,
But we choose faith, not fear.
He opens our eyes,
Fills us with peace,
Lifts up our weary souls.
He is the light, and we’ll never be,
We’ll never be alone.

[Chorus]
Though fires may burn
And storms may rage,
When darkness comes,
We’ll find our way back home.
We will trust in the Lord.
Though tears may fall
And friends may leave,
We see His light,
And that’s where we will go.
We will trust in the Lord.
We will trust in the Lord.

With all of our hearts,
We won’t trust in the world,
We’ll trust in the One who made us all.

[Chorus]
Though fires may burn
And storms may rage,
When darkness comes
We’ll find our way back home.
We will trust in the Lord.
Though tears may fall
And friends may leave,
We see His light,
And that’s where we will go.
We will trust in the Lord.
We will trust in the Lord.
We will trust in the Lord.

Teach me to walk in the light of his love;

videos.description:
Grateful for the Rain
Artist: Myshaan, Huia Shortland
Songwriter: Garon Brett and Nik Day 
Arranger and Producer: Mitch Davis

Stream now: https://ffm.to/gratefulfortherain

Lyrics

I’ve been in the fight swinging left 
Dodging right, get no rest 
Life been trying to knock me to my knees 
 
I been laying down in my bed 
Spinning round in my head 
Crying out for God to rescue me 
 
Pre-chorus: 
With every step I’m falling back two or three 
But I never let it get the best of me 
Or keep me down 
Cause I know it makes me stronger 
 
Chorus: 
Stars don’t shine without the darkness 
Sun don’t rise without the shade 
We can’t smile without the sadness 
We can’t heal without the pain 
There is salty and sweet 
Mountains high valleys deep 
Flowers bloom after storm cloudy days 
It’s hard when it keeps falling 
But I’m grateful for the rain 
 
Verse 2: 
Every day like 
Hitting the red lights 
Back in the deep 
Trying to see when it’s the dark of night 
 
Feel the pressure and it 
Pulls me in 
Here we go again 
But I keep trying cause 
 
When the weight is heavy and it’s hard to breathe 
When the waves are steady crashing down on me 
Something lifts me up 
And nothing’s ever gonna stop me 
 
Chorus 
 
If I didn’t have the chaos wouldn’t know the peace 
If I didn’t feel the hurt I wouldn’t know relief 
It’s true that I can’t have this joy without the grief 
I guess that all these ups and downs are good for me 
If I didn’t have the chaos wouldn’t know the peace 
If I didn’t feel the hurt I wouldn’t know relief 
It’s true that I can’t have this joy without the grief 
Without the grief 
 
Chorus

videos.title: Strive to Be Concert | Trust in the Lord | feat. Patch Crowe, Nik Day, McKenna Hixson, Yahosh Bonner
videos.description:
Strive to Be Concert | Trust in the Lord | feat. Patch Crowe, Nik Day, McKenna Hixson, Yahosh Bonner

A Strive to Be Concert, Trust in the Lord, will be broadcast live on Saturday, June 4, 2022, at 7 p.m., mountain daylight time (MDT).

The concert, originating from the Conference Center in Salt Lake City, will feature live performances of songs on this year’s youth theme album, including the 2022 theme song, “Trust in the Lord.” The album (available for free download) features a variety of uplifting, modern songs for youth worldwide. The recorded concert is one of several resources that support the 2022 youth theme, which include the website, album and video.

The youth theme album can be streamed on a total of 35 different streaming platforms, including the 2022 youth theme website, Spotify, Apple Music, YouTube, Gospel Library, and the Sacred Music app. Language versions of the album will be added to these platforms as they become available.

videos.title: Found Me
videos.description:
Composers: Garon Brett and Nik Day
Arrangers: Mitch Davis & Todd Thành Trung Trần
Producer Mitch Davis
Artists: Patch Crowe & Ysaac Martínez Marrero

Found Me
 
Deep inside a dark prison cell, 
Tried but I couldn’t save myself. 
Running from the Savior’s grace, 
Sinking in the crashing waves, 
I was hurting, still believing the lies. 
Lies. 
 
He was walking on the water 
When I came a little closer to try, try. 
And then my faith began to falter, 
And I started falling back in the tide. 
 
Chorus: 
That’s when He found me, 
Lost in the dead of the night. 
That’s when He found me, 
Pulled me into the light. 
He knew just who I was, 
And with His grace and love, 
Showed me who I could be. 
That’s when He found, found, found, found me. 
That’s when He found, found, found, found me. 
 
Caminando en la oscuridad,  
Perdido en la tempestad, 
Triste-y sin poder volver, 
Con temor en todo mi ser, 
Dañándome con mis mentiras aún más y más. 
 
El caminaba sobre-el agua. 
Yo-intenté pero no pude andar, andar. 
Mas temí a la tormenta, 
Y mi fe ya no la pude hallar, hallar. 
 
Chorus 
 
Bridge: 
I was lost and alone, but then I found the one to hold onto, 
And now I’m never leaving His side. 
And I’m running on oceans, and there’s no sign that I’m slowing 
‘Cause now I’m finally doing it right. 
 
Chorus

Yahosh Bonner delivers with a strong bass and blues riffs in this live music performance to remind us that Jesus Christ saves us from who were were and makes us better. We may have come from the DUST, but we are RISING UP to our divine potential. The trials we face may try to crush us, but they become the pressure that turn us to #diamonds. The fires of life try to burn us, but they become the heat that refines us. "I'm not who I was. I'm rising up from the dust!"

Tell us how you've seen Jesus Christ change you–or someone you love–in the comments below!

Written by Nik Day

Bassist: Desmond Whitney
Guitarist: Brady Bills
Drummer: Aaron Anderson 

🎧 Lyrics:

I was made from the ashes,
I was part of the earth.
And I could stay in ground or find the way out
And shake off the dirt.

Pre-Chorus
I cried to my Maker, and He saved my soul.
And I’m headed to the city with the streets of gold
Far on the opposite side of the setting sun.

Chorus:
I’m rising up,
My soul is on fire.
Nothing’s got a hold on me.
I’m rising up—
Up from the rubble.
I was drowning, but now I’m free.
My chains are broken;
I am a better man.
I found my way to the promised land.
I’m not who I was;
I’m rising up from the dust.

Like a diamond under pressure,
Like metal to the flame,
I was broken down, but I’m not broken now.
I’m stronger from all the pain.

Pre-Chorus
The rivers that I cross are gonna wash me clean.
And the summits that I’m on will help my blind eyes see
Far on the opposite side,
And though it’s a slow climb.

Chorus:
I’m rising up,
My soul is on fire.
Nothing’s got a hold on me.
I’m rising up—
Up from the rubble.
I was drowning, but now I’m free.
My chains are broken;
I am a better man.
I found my way to the promised land.
I’m not who I was;
I’m rising up from the dust.

Final Chorus:
I’m rising up,
My soul is on fire.
Nothing’s got a hold on me.
I’m rising up—
Up from the rubble.
I was drowning, but now I’m free.
My chains are broken;
I am a better man.
I found my way to the promised land.
I’m not who I was;
I’m rising up from the dust.

Patch Crowe is back with "Send Me," from the Strive to Be 2022 album! We can try trusting in something other than Jesus Christ, but it would be like building a mansion in the sand--easily washed away. This heartfelt song reminds us to look to Heaven instead--to let God take the helm and direct our lives. We are never alone when we choose to follow Jesus Christ.

When have you chosen to put God first in your life? SHARE in the COMMENTS.

A much higher view.
And my heart is willing
To follow You.

Send me.

To follow You.

You have my heart You have my hands.
I think I’m ready,
So, let me try.

Here am I.
I know I’m not perfect,
But here am I.
Tell me what You need;
You have my heart You have my hands.
I think I’m ready,
So, let me try.
Here am I,
Send me.
Send me. Mm
Send me.

We don't deserve the Lord's forgiveness. We can't earn His love or His mercy. And yet, He provides a way for our sins to be washed away. How is it done? We offer a little faith and He provides amazing grace. The Atonement of Jesus Christ is the greatest miracle He performed, and He did it for each one of us. 

SHARE what the Atonement of Jesus Christ has done for YOU in the comments.

All my wrongs have been erased.

Chorus:
How is it done
That beggars like me 
Can feel the love He freely gives
That opens eyes and makes us free?

Live in my soul?

How is it done? 
How is it done?

That opens eyes and makes us free?
How does this hope 
Live in my soul?

How is it done? 
How is it done?

Sometimes life is so HARD! We feel like we are getting beaten down--like with sticks and stones. We may feel broken by our struggles, sins, and trials, but no matter what happens, Jesus Christ is always there for us. He loves us no matter what we have done or how broken we may feel. He wants us to turn to Him, but if we do, He makes a way forward for each one of us. He can heal us and bring us joy. He fixes what's broken. Every good thing, all of our hope for brighter and better days ahead comes from Jesus Christ.

How do you SHARE Christ's hope and healing with others? Tell us in the comments.

Sometimes people think of faith as a feeling, but faith is a choice. "All My Heart" is one of Strive to Be's many inspirational songs about choosing faith in Jesus Christ. We may have questions. We may have doubts. There are certainly things we don't know or yet understand, but we can choose to lean into what we do know. We can choose to trust the Lord. We can choose to stay committed to Him even when life get hard. He doesn't want us to commit a portion of ourselves to Him, He wants us to go all in. 

Are you COMMITTED to Jesus Christ? Are you giving him ALL your heart? Share in the comments.

🎧 Lyrics:

I told myself so long ago,
Though I stumble, though I fall,
I’ll walk this road forever.
I know that half a heart won’t do. 
I’m giving all of me. I choose
To walk next to the Savior.

Pre-chorus: 
With all my weakness, all my flaws,
He says He loves me more than I 
Can ever know. I’ll put my trust
In Him

Chorus:
With all my heart.
I will follow Him in faith 
With all my heart,
All my mind, and all my strength. 
He takes my fear and gives me hope.
He takes my pain, then lets it go. 
So I will serve and I will love 
With all my heart.
With all my heart.

With every single breath I take, 
I’ll breathe in light. I’ll sing His praise 
Wherever life may lead me,
And every weary soul I see
Will feel the love He gave to me,
A love that’s never ending. 

Pre-chorus:
He showed the way 
Where I should go.
I’ll follow Him through every road 
He takes me through 
So that He knows I lived 

Chorus:
With all my heart.
I will follow Him in faith 
With all my heart,
All my mind, and all my strength. 
He takes my fear and gives me hope.
He takes my pain, then lets it go. 
So I will serve and I will love 
With all my heart.

Final Chorus:
With all my heart.
I will follow Him in faith 
With all my heart,
All my mind, and all my strength. 
He takes my fear and gives me hope.
He takes my pain, then lets it go. 
So I will serve and I will love 
With all my heart.

With all my heart.

Connor Austin, from South Africa, sings this great reminder of Christ's unfailing loyalty to us. He is THERE FOR US in all of our hard times. "He'll Be There" is encouraging because hard times are inevitable, but we don't need to go through them alone. 

Share this song with someone who needs the reminder that Jesus Christ is there for them--no matter what.

COMMENT BELOW: How has Jesus Christ been there for YOU?

Your teen Christian playlist NEEDS "Your Love Reminds Me" added right now! None of us can afford to forget the merciful LOVE that Jesus Christ offers us. He reminds us that He thought we were worth saving--even when we aren't so sure ourselves. He reminds us who we really are--if we will trust Him and listen to His words. "Your Love Reminds Me" gives hope that on our dark days, we can move forward in the assurance that we can't fall farther than the light of Christ's Atonement shines. No matter where we've been, or what we've done, healing and joy are still possible through Jesus Christ's enduring love.

What reminds YOU of Jesus Christ's love? COMMENT below.

Words and Music by Nik Day
Arranged by Mike McClellan
Produced by Mitch Davis
Artist: Kimberly Knighton

🎧 Lyrics:

When I feel torn apart,
You put me together again. 
When you take away my scars,
It helps me remember who I am. 

Chorus: 
Your love reminds me
The worth of my soul 
Is so much deeper than the oceans 
And brighter than gold.
Your hands designed me,
And you’ll never let go.
When I start to forget,
Your love reminds me.
Your love reminds me.

I feel it in my heart. 
Nobody loves me like you do. 
And when the light seems lost,
You touch my eyes and pull me through. 

Chorus: 
Your love reminds me
The worth of my soul 
Is so much deeper than the oceans 
And brighter than gold.
Your hands designed me,
And you’ll never let go.
When I start to forget,
Your love reminds me.

Bridge:
When I don’t trust myself, I trust you. 
You are the only way and truth I’ve ever found.
And I know you will never fail me.
When I’m drowning in my fears, you set me free. 

Chorus:
Your love reminds me
The worth of my soul 
Is so much deeper than the oceans 
And brighter than gold.
Your hands designed me,
And you’ll never let go.
When I start to forget,
Your love reminds me.
Your love reminds me.

Have you ever felt like you were stuck in life? Have you ever looked around and felt like there were no good options left to choose from? Sometimes we make choices that hurt us and we feel like there is no way out. "I Choose You" reminds us that Jesus Christ IS the way. He can ALWAYS make a way back to the path of safety and peace--if we choose HIM. If you have chosen a path that isn't bringing you peace, you can change course. You can ALWAYS choose Jesus Christ.

How has choosing the Lord brought you peace? Share in the comments.

Words and Music by Alyson Day and Nik Day
Arranged by Mitch Davis
Produced by Mitch Davis
Artist: Leah Campbell

🎧 Lyrics:

I was frozen,
Didn’t know which way I was going,
Standing at the door never knowing
What would happen on the other side.
I was sinking,
Trying to turn back time, hesitating.
I got tired of silently fading, 
So I turned to the light.

Chorus:
I choose You.
You are my answer,
And I choose You.
I’m Yours forever. 
You’re the peace in the storm. You’re the fire in the cold. 
You’re the wind that carries me through. 
And I choose You.

I was shaking,
But I faced my fears, and I’m changing.
And I’m on my way. Walls are breaking,
And hope is burning bright. 

No more sitting and wishing or silent resisting, 
I’m giving into Your love.
And I’ve traveled to places that never existed 
Before I said You’re the one.

Chorus:
And I choose You.
You are my answer,
And I choose You.
I’m Yours forever. 
You’re the peace in the storm. You’re the fire in the cold. 
You’re the wind that carries me through. 
And I choose You.

Final Chorus:
I choose You.
You are my answer,
And I choose You.
You are my Savior.
You’re the peace in the storm. You’re the fire in the cold. 
You’re the wind that carries me through. 
And I choose You.

videos.title: In a world full of darkness, Jesus Christ is the only true source of light | Light My Way | Nik Day
videos.description:
“I wrote this song with my sister, Alyson. She sent me a ballad idea called ‘Light My Way,’ and I made it more upbeat. In a world full of darkness, Jesus Christ is the only true source of light. You can try to find light in other places, but you’ll always be searching for more. His light can lead us to eternal happiness.” —Nik Day

#strivetobe

videos.title: "I Surrender" feat. Josh Dalley | 2022 YOUTH music album | #strivetobe Concert
videos.description:
"I Surrender" feat. Josh Dalley | 2022 YOUTH music album | #strivetobe Concert

“I loved singing ‘I Surrender’ because it is a great example of a song that is both upbeat and uplifting. There’s definitely a time and place for more reverent music. I also love that we can have songs that sound like this and still have a great message. It was so fun to sing!” —Josh Dalley

videos.title: Heavenly Father wants to hear from you. | Speak to Me | Strive To Be
videos.description:
He wants to know what makes you happy and grateful, but He also wants to know your questions and fears, your challenges and struggles. 

And why does He want to hear from you?

So that you can hear from Him. 

“In those two words—‘Hear Him’—God gives us the pattern for success, happiness, and joy in this life. … As we seek to be disciples of Jesus Christ, our efforts to hear Him need to be ever more intentional.” —President Russell M. Nelson, “Hear Him,” general conference, Apr. 2020

videos.title: Nothing’s impossible! Everything’s possible with Him!’ | Strive To Be
videos.description:
“I was privileged to sing ‘Possible with Him’ on the Strive To Be album, and what an experience! It was easy to feel the passion behind the lyrics and put my own emotion into the song. The words are something that I truly believe in: ‘Nothing’s impossible! Everything’s possible with Him!’

“The youth music is a powerful tool for connecting daily with God and worshipping through song!” —Ryan Johnson

videos.title: For those who feel broken, lost, confused, unsure or overwhelmed, He is the Healer! | #StriveToBe
videos.description:
“I had so much fun performing in the Strive to Be concert; working with all the artists and musicians on stage always brings me joy. I love the strength of all our testimonies coming together through music!

“‘Healer’ is a powerful song that always reminds me of the wonderful roles Jesus Christ plays in our lives! He is many things for each of us—a friend, brother, and the Savior of the world. And for those who feel broken, lost, confused, unsure or overwhelmed, He is the Healer!” —McKenna

videos.title: “A Savior is Born" | #StriveToBe
videos.description: Have you heard our Christmas album? You can stream this song, “A Savior is Born,” wherever you listen to music. Listen to the full album here:  https://ffm.to/asaviorisborn

videos.title: NEW praise song!
videos.description: “‘Dust’ is a song that really lifts me up! Just knowing that regardless of how low my lows get—even as low as the dust—I can rise up and overcome because of the love of my Savior. He lights my soul on fire!” —Yahosh Bonner

videos.title: Christmas Message | Strive to Be
videos.description: Like all of us, the Savior started out as a baby. Like all of us, He had to learn and grow. And just like Him, we can change the world—one small act of kindness at a time.

videos.title: The First Noel | Strive to Be
videos.description:
The first “noel”—or the first Christmas greeting—was indeed delivered to certain poor shepherds. But the message would eventually go out to the entire world! We share the message today, filling in for the angels to let people know that the Savior was born; that He died and was resurrected for us; and that He lives today to heal and bless us. The message of that first noel will echo forever. 
https://ffm.to/asaviorisborn

videos.title: Angels We Have Heard on High | Strive to Be
videos.description: Being a shepherd 2,000 years ago was important, but it wasn’t very prestigious. Shepherds weren’t high up on the social ladder. The job was hard work and had long hours. And yet near Bethlehem, a select few of these humble caretakers were given a sacred privilege that the rich and powerful did not have: They got to hear the angels announce the birth of the Savior, who would grow up to be a Shepherd to us all.

videos.title: FSY: Where I Learned about Self-Worth
videos.description:
“I’m able to tell everyone for the first time in my life that I am absolutely positive that I am worth something. That experience at FSY gave that to me.” —Eva 

What can For the Strength of Youth (FSY) conference do for you? 

Click here to see when FSY registration opens in your area: https://www.churchofjesuschrist.org/youth/childrenandyouth/fsy/about/registration-timeline

videos.title: I Can Do All Things Through Christ: Franchesca
videos.description:
My friends have noticed that I don’t drink coffee or tea. One day they asked me a lot of questions about my faith. I was really scared because of all the questions and all the pressure. But I trusted in the Lord, and I was able to share my testimony and answer their questions from the heart. 

As a result, I was able to invite my whole friend group to church that day. Through the guidance of Jesus Christ, I am able to set a good example to those around me and overcome my challenges at the same time. Through Christ I can find true happiness. My name is Franchesca, and I can do all things through Christ. —Franchesca #AllThingsThroughChrist

videos.title: FSY: Where Strangers Became My Friends
videos.description:
“When we got to FSY, we were all strangers, but by the second hour that we were there, we were brothers. It's really changed my perception of how I see the world.” —Dakota

videos.title: Worldwide Event for Youth: I Can Do All Things Through Christ
videos.description:
Join with youth gathered worldwide and in the Conference Center on Temple Square to learn how Jesus Christ is the strength of youth.

The youth theme for 2023 is “I can do all things through Christ which strengtheneth me” (Philippians 4:13). This theme encourages youth to look to Jesus Christ as their source of strength in all they do. The theme will be the focus of FSY conferences and can be used in weekly activities, camps, and Sunday lessons to unify the youth of the Church.

The 2023 youth music album and theme song, youth theme artwork, activity ideas, and other information can be found at https://www.churchofjesuschrist.org/learn/youth-theme-2023?lang=eng

videos.title: FSY: Where I Learned to Feel the Spirit
videos.description:
“It was nice to take a step away from the world. To just make new friends and meet new people. It was so centered on the gospel and feeling the Spirit.” —Annie

It's not too late to sign up for a For the Strength of Youth (FSY) conference! Do you have any questions about FSY? 

Click here for answers: https://www.churchofjesuschrist.org/youth/childrenandyouth/fsy/about/frequently-asked-questions Frequently Asked Questions For the Strength of Youth (FSY) Conferences

videos.title: Worldwide Event for Youth Highlight Video: I Can Do All Things Through Christ
videos.description:

Elder Gerrit W. Gong, President Bonnie H. Cordon, President Steven J. Lund, and youth just like you gather to introduce the youth theme for 2023: “I can do all things through Christ which strengtheneth me” (Philippians 4:13).

videos.title: I Can Do All Things Through Christ: Lily
videos.description:
"I have an autoimmune disease called alopecia. My immune system attacks my hair, essentially, and prevents it from growing. A couple of years ago, I decided somewhat spontaneously to shave my hair and just go bald. 

"Going back to school this year was pretty difficult for me, but there have been a lot of things that have kind of built up to allow me to know that God doesn’t really care what I look like. As rough as it can be when other people think that you’re weird or strange or just are confused because you’re different, that doesn’t really matter. 

"All that matters is that you know that God loves you and that He can help you to get through anything. My name is Lily, and I can do all things through Christ." —Lily 

#allthingsthroughchrist #lds #ldsyouth #faith #alopecia 

To learn more from other youth like Lily,

videos.description:
Huia Shortland Myshaan sings Grateful for the Rain from the 2023 Youth Album. 

Artist: Myshaan, Huia Shortland
Songwriter: Garon Brett and Nik Day 
Arranger and Producer: Mitch Davis
Lyric video creation: Kalebe Ludovico

Lyrics

I’ve been in the fight swinging left 
Dodging right, get no rest 
Life been trying to knock me to my knees 
 
I been laying down in my bed 
Spinning round in my head 
Crying out for God to rescue me 
 
Pre-chorus: 
With every step I’m falling back two or three 
But I never let it get the best of me 
Or keep me down 
Cause I know it makes me stronger 
 
Chorus: 
Stars don’t shine without the darkness 
Sun don’t rise without the shade 
We can’t smile without the sadness 
We can’t heal without the pain 
There is salty and sweet 
Mountains high valleys deep 
Flowers bloom after storm cloudy days 
It’s hard when it keeps falling 
But I’m grateful for the rain 
 
Verse 2: 
Every day like 
Hitting the red lights 
Back in the deep 
Trying to see when it’s the dark of night 
 
Feel the pressure and it 
Pulls me in 
Here we go again 
But I keep trying cause 
 
When the weight is heavy and it’s hard to breathe 
When the waves are steady crashing down on me 
Something lifts me up 
And nothing’s ever gonna stop me 
 
Chorus 
 
If I didn’t have the chaos wouldn’t know the peace 
If I didn’t feel the hurt I wouldn’t know relief 
It’s true that I can’t have this joy without the grief 
I guess that all these ups and downs are good for me 
If I didn’t have the chaos wouldn’t know the peace 
If I didn’t feel the hurt I wouldn’t know relief 
It’s true that I can’t have this joy without the grief 
Without the grief 
 
Chorus

videos.title: I Can Do All Things Through Christ: Kira | Christian Youth Stories
videos.description:
"I Can Do All Things Through Christ: Kira" | Christian Youth Stories | #strivetobe Youth Music Channel | WATCH THIS inspiring story of a Christian youth who struggled with depression and how she found strength through Christ. We hope you find inspiration and joy as you watch this #inspirationalvideo on the #strivetobe Youth Music Channel. We know you can do #AllThingsThroughChrist and find hope in Him. We'd LOVE to hear from you in the comments! Let us know what touched you the most, what you'd like to see on our channel, and how we can help you liver closer to our Savior, Jesus Christ, everyday!

Chapters:
00:00 Kira's struggle with depression
00:13 Turning to the Lord
00:30 The value of self-worth

Transcript:
I struggled with depression beginning around ninth grade. I struggled with it for a long time. I felt shame. I’m also very independent. I like to solve things and do it by myself. That was hard for me to overcome—that it’s OK to reach out for help. It’s not a weakness but a strength. 

The Lord was the first person I went to. I was going through a lot, and I needed someone to hold on to. I knew that He wouldn’t judge me and He would always be there and that I could talk to Him about anything. We have infinite worth and value no matter what we’ve been through. —Kira

#AllThingsThroughChrist #lds #ldsyouth #faith #depression 

To learn more from other youth like Kira,

HAVE YOU SEEN this new #inspirationalvideo  about how Derrick compares mechanics to strengthening our testimonies in Jesus Christ? We hope you find inspiration as you watch this #christianshorts . How do you strengthen your faith in Jesus Christ? 

Chapters:
00:00 - 00:20 Derrick's experience as a mechanic 
00:21 - 00:37 Strengthening our everyday lives 
00:38 - 01:00 Derrick's testimony

Transcript:
I'm a heavy diesel mechanic. And my job is to rebuild the trailers, so I take off all the parts that are broken or getting worn out and I put on all-new parts. I'm strengthening the trailer. That's what I'm doing. I'm taking off the parts that are wearing out and are weakened and I'm putting new strong parts on.

I feel like that’s something we need to do in our everyday lives. We need to find areas where we’re weakened or wearing out and we need to strengthen them. I'm not saying you need to take your testimony, throw it out the window, and get a new one. You need to take your old one and build on that.

I'm leaving on my mission soon, and I've always known that I wanted to go on my mission ever since I was eight years old. I love sharing the good things that I have, and the gospel is probably one of the greatest things that I have. If God’s on my side, then I can do anything I need to do, not anything I want to do, anything I need to do. My name is Derrick. I can do all things through Christ.

videos.title: I Can Do All Things: Sarah | Christian Shorts | #Inspirational Youth | #strivetobe
videos.description:
I Can Do All Things: Sarah | Christian Shorts | #Inspirational Youth | #strivetobe | CAN YOU BELIEVE that Sarah started her own #construction business at age 16? Be inspired as you WATCH how she learned that God’s work is most important. How have you learned that God’s work is more important than your own? Share with us in the comments! 

Chapters: 
00:00 00:13 Sarah's construction business
00:14 00:34 Facing challenges
00:35 00:59 Sarah's lesson about God's Work

Transcript:
When I was sixteen years old, I decided that I wanted to start my own construction business. I had been helping my dad my whole life, just get used to construction and power tools, and I just really grew to love it. One hard thing that I had to overcome this year with my new house was my employee. My older brother was supposed to come home from his mission.

And one day on his mission, he called me and he said, “Sarah, I was asked to extend and I just have to do it.” And I was like, “You know what, Tyler? You can't do it because we have to get this house done.” He said, “Sarah, the Lord's work is more important than your work.” And that just hit me. And I know that that's so true, and I know that the Lord's work is more important than anything that I have going on in my life. But I also know that because my older brother is serving a mission, that the Lord is going to help make my work possible. My name is Sarah and I can do all things through Christ.

I Can Do All Things Through Christ: Kimberlee | Christian Shorts #youth HAVE YOU SEEN this #inspirational video where Kimberlee shares how she was strengthened through Christ after her diagnosis of a rare and serious skin disorder? Have you had a time where Christ has helped you with a challenge? Share with us in the comments! 

Chapters: 
00:00 00:09 Introduction
00:10 00:22 Kimberlee's trial
00:23 00:32 Kimberlee's accomplishments 
00:33 00:44 Strengthened through Christ
00:45 00:59 Testimony

Transcript:
My name is Kimberlee, and five years ago, I was diagnosed with a rare and serious skin disorder called toxic epidermal necrolysis. I lost 70% of my skin in just two days and spent three weeks in a specialized burn unit to get treatment. I dealt with severe pain while in the hospital and have had some lasting complications as a result of this illness.

Since then, I have been able to move past these complications. I am now a member of my high school swim team and a part of multiple high school clubs. Even though it was extremely difficult, this experience helped me to better know Christ. I felt Him near me, giving me emotional and physical strength that I needed to overcome this challenge. I have a testimony of Christ's role as my Savior. I know He understands exactly what we go through. He suffered for all of the sins, pains and heartaches that I face. I know He is always on my side. Whenever I reach out to Him, He is always there to lift me up. My name is Kimberlee and I can do all things through Christ.

00:32 00:45 The Lord is our shepherd 
00:46 01:01 Taking care of sheep 
01:02 01:11 Seeing the Lord's hand 
01:12 01:28 Burliegh's final thoughts

Translation: 
I live on a farm, and we work sheep, a small herd of cows, and sometimes chickens. Today is the summertime and we usually take the sheep up to a grazing area. We would keep them out for about eight hours a day. We would just watch them. Then we put them in the pen and we walked around it to see if any of them are limping or walking funny or any other stuff that could be wrong with them.
 
The Lord is our shepherd, which—I am the shepherd of our sheep. I really like to think of sheep because we are technically His sheep to the Lord. It just is fun to watch over them and see how they react to you and eat and stuff.
 
If we don’t take care of them, then they will usually die of drought or not enough feed. The Lord would help us lead our animals and livestock to the right place and keep them away from danger. It is kind of hard to work sheep, especially with very few people there, but we usually get through it together. My name is Burliegh, and I can do all things through Christ.

--

HAVE YOU SEEN this new video where Gavin explains how friendship, therapy, and Christ helped him through his eating disorder? 

Chapters:
00:00 - 00:09 Introduction
00:10 - 00: 36 About Gavin's eating disorder
00:37 - 00:57 Christ is there for you

Transcript:
Hey, I'm Gavin, I’m Brigham and I'm Eli and we're best friends. When I was going through my eating disorder, I was really too embarrassed to talk to anyone or tell my friends. Even though I didn’t tell them, I still knew that when I was kind of feeling bad about myself, I just went to hang out with Brigham and Eli. We’d just have a good time, and I’d forget my worries. 

With a disease or disorder, it’s just so hard to get out of it. And my parents are always going to be there for me. And I know that. And I know Christ will also be there for me. Even though you may not want to do something at first, like therapy, that will really, really help in the long run, and that will just shape you into becoming who you are. Christ was always there for me, and He helped me through the tough times. My name is Gavin, and I can do all things through Christ.

videos.description:
Testigo Short | Stand as a WITNESS of Jesus #Christ | #strivetobe 2023 | #OriginalMV #OriginalSong

Welcome to the Strive To Be Youth YouTube Channel, presented by the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints! Watch this young woman witness of the teachings of Christ as she seeks to make a difference through acts of Christian service. 

In this uplifting video, we explore how Christian service allows us to become the hands of the Lord here on earth. Witness the impact of selfless love as this young woman uplifts those in need while following the example of Jesus Christ.

Watch the full-length "Testigo" video here: 
https://youtu.be/FIqu5Cg-Hw0

Or listen to the song from this year's youth album:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XNeb6DQRS0w

We are witnesses of Jesus Christ. When our words and actions testify of Him, it helps others to find Him in their own lives. 

----

Words and Music: Kimberly Knighton & Nik Day
Arranged by: Landon Alley, Mitch Davis
Produced by: Mitch Davis
Artist: Aliah Olmo

I was frozen,
Didn’t know which way I was going,
Standing at the door never knowing
What would happen on the other side.
I was sinking,
Trying to turn back time, hesitating.
I got tired of silently fading,
So I turned to the light.

Chorus:

I choose You.
You are my answer,
And I choose You.
I’m Yours forever.
You’re the peace in the storm. You’re the fire in the cold.
You’re the wind that carries me through.
And I choose You.
I was shaking,
But I faced my fears, and I’m changing.
And I’m on my way. Walls are breaking,
And hope is burning bright.
No more sitting and wishing or silent resisting,
I’m giving into Your love.
And I’ve traveled to places that never existed
Before I said You’re the one.

You are my answer,
And I choose You.
You are my Savior.
You’re the peace in the storm. You’re the fire in the cold.
You’re the wind that carries me through.

And I choose You.

Mmm

You are my answer,
And I choose You.
You are my Savior.
You’re the peace in the storm. You’re the fire in the cold.

CHECK OUT our new single "Together"! We hope you feel inspired and strengthened as you listen. We are TOGETHER in our commitment to Christ. We celebrate second chances, redemption, and His hope, together. Where have you felt ignited by your faith in Christ? Share with us in the comments! 

Make sure to stream this song on your favorite platform: https://strivetobe.idm.fm/together

Written by Tyler Castleton and McKay Crockett
Arranged by Mykyl, Tyler Castleton, and McKay Crockett
Produced by Mykyl, Tyler Castleton, and McKay Crockett
Artist: Rob Michelson

🎧 Lyrics:

This is a shout to the broken, the one who doubts.
A shout to saints and sinners, just trying to figure it out.  
To every warrior in the fight of your life: fight.  

This is a song to the hiding, to anxious hearts.  
A song to those resigning, just sick of falling apart.  
To every fighter facing battles inside: fight.  

Chorus:

Cuz sparks become a fire when they burn united,  
River rises higher drop by drop.  
Ignited, a star becomes a galaxy forever.  
If we rise, if we fall, we’re together.  
We’re together.  

Here’s a shout to second chances and open doors.  
A shout that echos into a soul that’s hungry for more.  
To every hero in the dark of the night: there is light.  

Chorus:

Cuz sparks become a fire when they burn united,  
River rises higher drop by drop.  
Ignited, a star becomes a galaxy forever.  
If we rise, if we fall, we’re together.  
We’re together.  

We all hurt, we all cry, we’re together.  
We all sin, we all try, we’re together.  
We all fail, we all fall, we're together.  
But there’s One, through it all, keeps us together.  

We all hurt, we all cry, we’re together.  
We all sin, we all try, we’re together.  
We all fail, we all fall, we’re together.  
He’s the One, through it all, keeps us together.  

Final Chorus:

Cuz sparks become a fire when they burn united,  
River rises higher drop by drop.  
Ignited, a star becomes a galaxy forever.  
If we rise, if we fall.

Cuz sparks become a fire.
We all hurt, we all cry, river rises higher. 
A star becomes a galaxy forever.  
He’s the One, through it all, keeps us together.

After an endless night, 
My water in the desert,

When currents pull me under,

You calm my hurricanes, 
You make my oceans shallow, 
So I can face the waves. 
You give me strength to follow 
When you lead me through the storm.

My only hope. 
You saved my soul. 
You saved my soul. 
You are my light 
In the darkest night.  
You lead me home  
Through the unknown,  
My one true hope. 

When thunder rolls around me, 
You are my healing rain. 
You wash away my troubles 
And make me whole again. 
I’ll follow You forever, 
The one who wipes my tears away  
And gives me strength. 

Chorus 

You are my hope, 
My only hope. 
You saved my soul. 
You saved my soul. 
You are my light 
In the darkest night.  
You lead me home  
Through the unknown,  
My one true hope. 

Every time I think that my hope is gone, 
You’re the only thing that gives me strength to carry on. 
And You lift me up, and You pull me through. 
Yes, it’s all because of You, You, You. 

Chorus 

You are my hope, 
My only hope. 
You saved my soul. 
You saved my soul. 
You are my light 
In the darkest night.  
You lead me home  
Through the unknown,  
My one true hope.

After an endless night, 
My water in the desert,

You calm my hurricanes, 
You make my oceans shallow, 
So I can face the waves. 
You give me strength to follow 
When you lead me through the storm.

My only hope. 
You saved my soul. 
You saved my soul. 
You are my light 
In the darkest night.  
You lead me home  
Through the unknown,  
My one true hope. 

When thunder rolls around me, 
You are my healing rain. 
You wash away my troubles 
And make me whole again. 
I’ll follow You forever, 
The one who wipes my tears away  
And gives me strength. 

Chorus: 

You are my hope, 
My only hope. 
You saved my soul. 
You saved my soul. 
You are my light 
In the darkest night.  
You lead me home  
Through the unknown,  
My one true hope. 

Every time I think that my hope is gone, 
You’re the only thing that gives me strength to carry on. 
And You lift me up, and You pull me through. 
Yes, it’s all because of You, You, You. 

Chorus:

You are my hope, 
My only hope. 
You saved my soul. 
You saved my soul. 
You are my light 
In the darkest night.  
You lead me home  
Through the unknown,  
My one true hope.

videos.description:

Jesus Christ has many powerful names. He is the Truth, Light, and the Redeemer of mankind. He is our King, Deliverer, and the Savior of our souls. Which one of Christ’s names is especially meaningful to you? Share with us in the comments! 

Make sure to stream this song on your favorite platform: https://strivetobe.idm.fm/saviourofmysoul

Savior of My Soul | Official Music Video | Strive to Be

Written by Connor Austin, Luz Ysabelle Cuevas, and Nik Day
Arranged by Daniel Blomberg, Dave Zimmerman, Mitch Davis, and Sean Thatcher Hubrich
Produced by Mitch Davis
Artist: McKenna Hixson
Video directed by Cameron Gade

🎧 Lyrics

I've heard the stories all my life, 
The Prince of Peace, the Son of God, the source of endless light. 
He healed the sick and calmed the sea, 
He puts to rest the thundering waves inside of me. 

He rescued me,  
He set me free. 

Chorus: 

Beautiful Savior, 
The Way, the Truth divine.  
King and Deliverer, 
Redeemer of mankind.  
All of His many names 
Show His power and grace. 
He’s the Light, my healer, my guide,  
The Savior of my soul.    

Broken people, perfect love. 
He paved the way and paid the price so we could rise above  
The bands of death and find relief. 
With selfless pain, He bore His cross on Calvary. 

He rescued me,  
He set me free. 

Chorus 

Beautiful Savior, 
The Way, the Truth divine.  
King and Deliverer, 
Redeemer of mankind.  
All of His many names 
Show His power and grace. 
He’s the Light, my healer, my guide,  
The Savior of my soul.  

I will spend this life 
Giving all my time, 
Living line by line till I see  
How He’d trade His throne for a crown of thorns,  
And He did it all for me. 

Chorus 

Beautiful Savior, 
The Way, the Truth divine.  
King and Deliverer, 
Redeemer of mankind.  
All of His many names 
Show His power and grace. 
He’s the Light, my healer, my guide,  
The Savior of my soul.

videos.description:
Jesus Christ has many significant names that show His amazing power and grace. Which one of Christ’s names is especially meaningful to you?#strivetobe #gospelmusic #christianmusic #ldsmusic #jesuschrist 

Make sure to stream the album on your favorite platform: https://strivetobe.idm.fm/disciple-of-christ

Savior of my Soul | Official Track Video feat. McKenna Hixson | Strive to Be

Written by Connor Austin, Luz Ysabelle Cuevas, and Nik Day
Arranged by Daniel Blomberg, Dave Zimmerman, Mitch Davis, and Sean Thatcher Hubrich
Produced by Mitch Davis
Artist: McKenna Hixson


🎧 Lyrics

I've heard the stories all my life, 
The Prince of Peace, the Son of God, the source of endless light. 
He healed the sick and calmed the sea, 
He puts to rest the thundering waves inside of me. 

He rescued me,  
He set me free. 

Chorus

Beautiful Savior, 
The Way, the Truth divine.  
King and Deliverer, 
Redeemer of mankind.  
All of His many names 
Show His power and grace. 
He’s the Light, my healer, my guide,  
The Savior of my soul.    

Broken people, perfect love. 
He paved the way and paid the price so we could rise above  
The bands of death and find relief. 
With selfless pain, He bore His cross on Calvary. 

He rescued me,  
He set me free. 

Chorus 

Beautiful Savior, 
The Way, the Truth divine.  
King and Deliverer, 
Redeemer of mankind.  
All of His many names 
Show His power and grace. 
He’s the Light, my healer, my guide,  
The Savior of my soul.  

I will spend this life 
Giving all my time, 
Living line by line till I see  
How He’d trade His throne for a crown of thorns,  
And He did it all for me. 

Chorus 

Beautiful Savior, 
The Way, the Truth divine.  
King and Deliverer, 
Redeemer of mankind.  
All of His many names 
Show His power and grace. 
He’s the Light, my healer, my guide,  
The Savior of my soul.

videos.title: Over Mine | Official Track Video feat. Ben Olsen | Strive to Be
videos.description:
The power of the Atonement of Jesus Christ is real and available, for each of us. Because of Jesus Christ, we can be healed and perfected. We can try again. #strivetobe #discipleofchrist #jesuschrist 

Make sure to stream the album on your favorite platform: https://strivetobe.idm.fm/disciple-of-christ

Written by Ben Olsen and Nik Day
Arranged by Ben Olsen and Mitch Davis
Produced by Mitch Davis
Artist: Ben Olsen

Over Mine | Official Track Video feat. Ben Olsen | Strive to Be

🎧 Lyrics:

I should be paying my dues; 
I’m far from living like You. 
I try but I’m only human, 
A constant state of improving. 

But I feel the weight 
Lift from my plate. 

Chorus

I’ve got a list of the things I’ve done wrong, 
All the pain that I bore for so long. 
Justice was holding the cards, 
And mercy seemed so far. 
Then you stepped in between me and my fate, 
Took a pen to the charges I should pay. 
Right on the dotted line, 
You signed your name over mine. 

I owe You all of my soul; now 
I owe You every moment. 
Whatever I do won’t measure., 
I’m eternally indebted to You, 
But all You want is my broken heart. 

Chorus 

I’ve got a list of the things I’ve done wrong, 
All the pain that I bore for so long. 
Justice was holding the cards, 
And mercy seemed so far. 
Then you stepped in between me and my fate, 
Took a pen to the charges I should pay. 
Right on the dotted line, 
You signed your name over mine. 

Chorus 

I’ve got a list of the things I’ve done wrong, 
All the pain that I bore for so long. 
Justice was holding the cards, 
And mercy seemed so far. 
Then you stepped in between me and my fate, 
Took a pen to the charges I should pay. 
Right on the dotted line, 
You signed your name over mine.

videos.description:

Make sure to stream the album on your favorite platform: https://strivetobe.idm.fm/disciple-of-christ

Living Water | Official Track Video feat. James Thorup | Disciple of Christ

Written by Ben Olsen
Arranged by Ben Olsen, Gavin McMahan, and Mitch Davis
Produced by Gavin McMahan and Mitch Davis
Artist: James Thorup

🎧 Lyrics:

I’m tending to my garden, 
A few things I need to change. 
There ain’t a petal that’s too far gone. 

The grass is greener.  
The roses started blooming. 
Pulled the weeds out of my soul; I feel brand new. 

Chorus

Tonight 
I call off the inner fight,  
Allow the saving Light to shine  
Over my dying flowers and breathe in life, 
Born again and cleansed with Living Water. 

I’m picking up my pieces, 
Restoring my frame, 
Becoming whole through loving grace. 

I’m changing lenses from black and white 
To opened eyes, 
And now the world I saw before is full of color. 

Chorus 

Tonight 
I call off the inner fight,  
Allow the saving Light to shine  
Over my dying flowers and breathe in life, 
Born again and cleansed with Living Water. 

If someday I will stand before the one who saved me, 
I wanna be there blamelessly 
And hear how proud He is of who I’ve become. 
So every day I’ll heed the calling in my soul, 
Saying come unto me, my son. 

Chorus 

Tonight 
I call off the inner fight,  
Allow the saving Light to shine  
Over my dying flowers and breathe in life, 
Born again and cleansed with Living Water.

videos.title: When I Found You | Official Track feat. Madilyn Paige | Christian Youth Music
videos.description:
We hope you feel the LOVE of God though this song as it testifies that Jesus Christ is ALWAYS with you. #forthestrengthofyouth #christianmusic #jesuschrist

You NEVER have to walk alone. Christ will be there to bring you out of the darkest times and mend your broken soul. When is a time you have found yourself through Christ? 

Make sure to stream the album on your favorite platform: https://strivetobe.idm.fm/disciple-of-christ

Written by Connor Austin and Luz Ysabelle Cuevas
Arranged by Connor Austin, Mitch Davis, and Todd Trần
Produced by Mitch Davis
Artist: Madilyn Paige

When I Found You | Official Track Video feat. Madilyn Paige | Christian Youth Music

🎧 Lyrics

I was searching for a glimmer of light. 
I’ve been running ’round the desert in the dead of the night,  
Still hoping for a star in the sky 
To show me to my home.  
’Cause I’ve tried too many times,  
Trying to do it on my own, but I’ve been hurting inside.  
But I know You started the fire, 
Gave me Your hand to hold. 
 
Chorus

Yeah, You. 
Looking back on my life,  
At the darkest of times 
There was You. 
You took my broken soul,  
held me like I was gold. 
It was You. 
I was stranded 
When You gave me shelter. 
Calm the waves when they’re pulling me under.  
When I found You, I found myself. 
 
From the ashes I’m refined by the fire.  
Yeah, I found a new perspective when You opened my eyes. 
From my low lows to my highest of highs,  
I never walk alone.  
 
When I’m tossed and turned by the ocean, 
Your love pulls me to the surface. 
Now I have You as my compass, 
Show me where to go. 
 
Chorus 

Yeah, You. 
Looking back on my life,  
At the darkest of times 
There was You. 
You took my broken soul,  
held me like I was gold. 
It was You. 
I was stranded 
When You gave me shelter. 
Calm the waves when they’re pulling me under.  
When I found You, I found myself. 

Chorus 

Yeah, You. 
Looking back on my life,  
At the darkest of times 
There was You. 
You took my broken soul,  
held me like I was gold. 
It was You. 
I was stranded 
When You gave me shelter. 
Calm the waves when they’re pulling me under.  
When I found You, I found myself.

videos.title: Truth | Official Track Video feat. Connor Austin and Jarica Jamison | Christian Music
videos.description:
Do you stand for TRUTH? #strivetobe #discipleofchrist #jesuschrist 

Jesus will ALWAYS be there to guide us and give us hope. He helps us see our true potential. Let's stand for Him and strive for truth. How do you stand for truth in your own lives? Share with us in the comments!

🎵 Follow Strive to Be 
Instagram | https://www.instagram.com/strivetobe/ 
Website | Youth.ChurchofJesusChrist.org 
YouTube | https://www.youtube.com/strivetobe 
Apple Music | https://apple.co/2CJ1Y4M 
Spotify | https://open.spotify.com/artist/66YzHdK0FWCQSKMlXf3Rbj 

Written by Nik Day
Arranged by Connor Austin, Jarica Jamison, and Mitch Davis
Produced by Mitch Davis
Artist: Connor Austin, Jarica Jamison

Truth | Official Track Video feat. Connor Austin and Jarica Jamison | Christian Music

🎧 Lyrics:

All the smoke and the mirrors  
Try to leave me confused,  
But I won’t let it deceive me.  
I know what is true.  
There’s a God who made me,  
And He shines through the dark.  
He helps me see all I can be.  

Chorus

I stand for truth. 
I fight for truth  
In a world full of lies.  
With all of my might,  
I strive for truth, 
And I won’t be moved.  
When He calls out my name, 
I won’t be afraid. 
I’ll stand for truth. 
I stand for truth. 

There’s a truth that was spoken,  
Long before we were made.  
It sets love into motion,  
And it can never be changed.  
There’s a million voices,  
But only one is the way.  
He guides my soul and gives me hope. 

Chorus 

I stand for truth. 
I fight for truth  
In a world full of lies.  
With all of my might,  
I strive for truth, 
And I won’t be moved.  
When He calls out my name, 
I won’t be afraid. 
I’ll stand for truth. 
I stand for truth.

videos.description:
We hope this song helps you feel the LOVE Jesus has for YOU! #strivetobe #discipleofchrist #jesuschrist 

Jesus is always there with His hand extended because He chooses YOU! Has there been a time in your life where you have felt the Savior love for you? 

Make sure to stream the album on your favorite platform: https://strivetobe.idm.fm/disciple-of-christ

Instagram | https://www.instagram.com/strivetobe/

Written by Connor Austin, Luz Ysabelle Cuevas, Nik Day
Arranged and Produced by Gavin McMahan and Mitch Davis
Artist: Claire Quigley

He Still Chose Me | Official Track Video feat. Claire Quigley |  Christian Music

🎧 Lyrics:

Before I took my first breath  
I could feel His light within,  
Growing brighter as I know Him. 

When I reach out to Him, 
I can feel His love again. 
It reminds me of His promise 

That He’ll be with me 
In every hour.  
He singles out my voice in the crowd. 

Chorus

His strength can move the mountains,  
And His grace can part the seas.  
He’s the King of all creation,  
And He knows who I could be.  
In my heart I keep on saying  
I’m the last thing He would need,  
But despite my scars and all my flaws 
He still chose me.  

And I can feel His grace 
When I live my life with faith.  
He helped me find my purpose 

To give my broken heart, 
To love the way He loved, 
And follow in His footsteps. 

And He’ll be with me 
In every hour. 
He singles out my voice in the crowd. 

Chorus 

His strength can move the mountains,  
And His grace can part the seas.  
He’s the King of all creation,  
And He knows who I could be.  
In my heart I keep on saying  
I’m the last thing He would need,  
But despite my scars and all my flaws 
He still chose me.
